location.address: Computer Deconstruction Lab, Building 9059, 2201 Marconi Road, Wall Township, N.J. 07719, USA

ext_weather.name: Tonight
ext_weather.detailedForecast: Showers and thunderstorms before 4am, then a chance of showers and thunderstorms between 4am and 5am, then a slight chance of showers and thunderstorms. Some of the storms could be severe and produce heavy rain. Cloudy, with a low around 50. Southwest wind 10 to 20 mph, with gusts as high as 40 mph. Chance of precipitation is 80%. New rainfall amounts between a tenth and quarter of an inch possible.

space_weather:
Space Weather Message Code: SUMXM5
Serial Number: 154
Issue Time: 2022 Mar 31 2333 UTC

SUMMARY: X-ray Event exceeded M5
Begin Time: 2022 Mar 31 1817 UTC
Maximum Time: 2022 Mar 31 1835 UTC
End Time: 2022 Mar 31 1845 UTC
X-ray Class: M9.6
Optical Class: 1b
Location: N13W52
NOAA Scale: R2 - Moderate

NOAA Space Weather Scale descriptions can be found at
www.swpc.noaa.gov/noaa-scales-explanation

Potential Impacts: Area of impact centered primarily on sub-solar point on the sunlit side of Earth.
Radio - Limited blackout of HF (high frequency) radio communication for tens of minutes.

Space Weather Message Code: ALTTP2
Serial Number: 1126
Issue Time: 2022 Mar 31 2105 UTC

ALERT: Type II Radio Emission
Begin Time: 2022 Mar 31 1929 UTC
Estimated Velocity: 856 km/s

NOAA Space Weather Scale descriptions can be found at
www.swpc.noaa.gov/noaa-scales-explanation

Description: Type II emissions occur in association with eruptions on the sun and typically indicate a coronal mass ejection is associated with a flare event.

Space Weather Message Code: SUM10R
Serial Number: 730
Issue Time: 2022 Mar 31 2012 UTC

SUMMARY: 10cm Radio Burst
Begin Time: 2022 Mar 31 1928 UTC
Maximum Time: 2022 Mar 31 1934 UTC
End Time: 2022 Mar 31 1952 UTC
Duration: 24 minutes
Peak Flux: 290 sfu
Latest Penticton Noon Flux: 151 sfu

NOAA Space Weather Scale descriptions can be found at
www.swpc.noaa.gov/noaa-scales-explanation

Description: A 10cm radio burst indicates that the electromagnetic burst associated with a solar flare at the 10cm wavelength was double or greater than the initial 10cm radio background. This can be indicative of significant radio noise in association with a solar flare. This noise is generally short-lived but can cause interference for sensitive receivers including radar, GPS, and satellite communications.

Space Weather Message Code: ALTTP4
Serial Number: 566
Issue Time: 2022 Mar 31 1917 UTC

ALERT: Type IV Radio Emission
Begin Time: 2022 Mar 31 1841 UTC

NOAA Space Weather Scale descriptions can be found at
www.swpc.noaa.gov/noaa-scales-explanation

Description: Type IV emissions occur in association with major eruptions on the sun and are typically associated with strong coronal mass ejections and solar radiation storms.

Space Weather Message Code: ALTXMF
Serial Number: 278

ALERT: X-Ray Flux exceeded M5
Threshold Reached: 2022 Mar 31 1830 UTC

NOAA Space Weather Scale descriptions can be found at

Space Weather Message Code: WARK04
Serial Number: 4062
Issue Time: 2022 Mar 31 1434 UTC

EXTENDED WARNING: Geomagnetic K-index of 4 expected
Extension to Serial Number: 4061
Valid From: 2022 Mar 30 2311 UTC
Now Valid Until: 2022 Apr 01 0900 UTC
Warning Condition: Persistence

NOAA Space Weather Scale descriptions can be found at
www.swpc.noaa.gov/noaa-scales-explanation

Potential Impacts: Area of impact primarily poleward of 65 degrees Geomagnetic Latitude.
Induced Currents - Weak power grid fluctuations can occur.
Aurora - Aurora may be visible at high latitudes such as Canada and Alaska.

Space Weather Message Code: WARK05
Serial Number: 1655
Issue Time: 2022 Mar 31 1418 UTC

WARNING: Geomagnetic K-index of 5 expected
Valid From: 2022 Mar 31 1418 UTC
Valid To: 2022 Apr 01 0600 UTC
Warning Condition: Onset
NOAA Scale: G1 - Minor

NOAA Space Weather Scale descriptions can be found at
www.swpc.noaa.gov/noaa-scales-explanation

Potential Impacts: Area of impact primarily poleward of 60 degrees Geomagnetic Latitude.
Induced Currents - Weak power grid fluctuations can occur.
Spacecraft - Minor impact on satellite operations possible.
Aurora - Aurora may be visible at high latitudes, i.e., northern tier of the U.S. such as northern Michigan and Maine.

Space Weather Message Code: WARPC0
Serial Number: 95
Issue Time: 2022 Mar 31 1403 UTC

CANCEL WARNING: Proton 100MeV Integral Flux above 1pfu expected
Cancel Serial Number: 94
Original Issue Time: 2022 Mar 30 2012 UTC

Comment: >100 MeV proton flux expecxted to remain below warning threshold.

NOAA Space Weather Scale descriptions can be found at
www.swpc.noaa.gov/noaa-scales-explanation

Potential Impacts: An enhancement in the energetic portion of the solar radiation spectrum may indicate increased biological risk to astronauts or passengers and crew in high latitude, high altitude flights. Additionally, energetic particles may represent an increased risk to all satellite systems susceptible to single event effects. This information should be used in conjunction with the current Solar Radiation Storm conditions when assessing overall impact.
